title: Spack picks up wrong user after ksu

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
When trying to run an installation as a user that was switched to using `ksu`, Spack still determines the temp directory (set as `$tempdir/$user/spack-stage`) to be the $user from login, not the one switched to with `ksu`.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ ksu new-user
$ whoami
new-user
$ spack python -c "import spack.util.path as p; p.canonicalize_path('$tempdir/$user')"
'/tmp'
$ python
>>> import getpass
>>> print(getpass.getuser())
old-user
>>> import pwd
>>> print pwd.getpwuid(os.getuid())
pwd.struct_passwd(pw_name='new-user', pw_passwd='x', pw_uid=#####, pw_gid=#####, pw_gecos='<info>', pw_dir='/home/new-user', pw_shell='/bin/bash')
...
```

### Error Message

No error message, per se.  Just the fact that when building, the build stage ends up under `~/.spack`, which in the case of our HPC machines is an NFS mounted filesystem and causes the builds to be very slow, especially for expansive Spack Stacks installations.

### Information on your system

```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.3
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-broadwell
```
